title: Bodycall-Somatic_Turn-Dark_Electro_EBM_Synthpop
description:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ARTIST............ Bodycall
ALBUM TITLE....... Somatic Turn
GENRE............. Electronic
STYLE............. (in order of relevance) Dark-Electro, Synthpop, EBM, Darkwave, 
                   Aggrotech/Hellectro, Industrial
COVER ART......... Included
MORE INFO......... www.last.fm/music/Bodycall
                  
RELEASE DATE...... 11/2008
RELEASED BY....... JAD830
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bodycall plays dark electro / ebm / synthpop music. It was formed in 2002 in Wroclaw, Poland. Born in surroundings consisting of depressing Eastern European blocks of flats, abandoned factories and rusty unused railways, Bodycall started as a hybrid of many dark underground electronic styles. Bodycall&#039;s musicians were, at various stages involved in numerous death metal/grindcore bands, several hardcore techno, trance or, more recently, dark electronic projects.

"Somatic Turn" is hard to classify. There are purely dark electro or ebm songs as well as classic synthpop or darkwave ones. It is likely to attract a wide spectrum of listeners. Nearly every follower of the "Dark Scene" will find something for him/herself. Very good add to your musical library - whether you are a fan of dark electro, synthpop, ebm, darkwawe, even gothic - or you just like a bit of everything of this sort.


Tracklist:
01. We are the Crowd
02. Hate Me
03. On and On
04. You and Me
05. Bodycall Again
06. Minor Immortality
07. Fools&#039; Paradise
08. Beyond Control
09. Dancing in the Dark
10  Disciples of Hedone
11. You and Me (Club Version)


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Bodycall is similiar (often remotely) to, or inspired by: Amduscia, Apoptygma Berzerk, Combichrist, Covenant, Das Ich, Deine Lakaien, Diary of Dreams, Front 242, Funker Vogt, God Module, Grendel, GGFH, Hocico, Icon of Coil, In Strict Confidence, Project Pitchfork, Psyclon Nine, Spetsnaz, Suicide Commando.
